search_results.snippet: The affective domain represents one of the three divisions described in modern psychology: the cognitive, the conative, and the affective. Classically, these divisions have also been referred to as the "ABC of psychology", [citation needed] in that case using the terms "affect", "behavior", and "cognition".

search_results.snippet: Jump to: navigation, search. Affective science is the scientific study of emotion or affect. This includes the study of emotion elicitation, emotional experience and the recognition of emotions in others.
